requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

user_context.requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: Users must be able to add new tasks to their to-do list via a text input field.
acceptance_criteria: An input field is displayed on the screen.
User can type a task description into the input field.
Pressing an "Add" button or the "Enter" key adds the task to the list.
The input field is cleared after the task is added.

functional_requirements.description: The application must display the list of all created tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All added tasks are displayed in a clear, vertical list.
Each item in the list shows the task description.

functional_requirements.description: Users must be able to mark a task as completed or incomplete.
acceptance_criteria: Each task in the list has a checkbox or a similar toggle control.
Clicking the checkbox marks the task as completed.
Completed tasks are visually differentiated from pending tasks (e.g., with a strikethrough).
The completion status is saved and persists between sessions.

functional_requirements.description: Users must be able to edit the description of an existing task.
acceptance_criteria: An "Edit" option is available for each task.
Activating the "Edit" option allows the user to modify the task's description.
Saving the changes updates the task in the list.

functional_requirements.description: Users must be able to remove a task from their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: A "Delete" option is available for each task.
Clicking the "Delete" option removes the task from the list permanently.

functional_requirements.description: The application must save the user's tasks so they are not lost when the page is refreshed or closed.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks are saved to the browser's local storage.
When the user reloads or re-opens the browser, their tasks are restored to the last saved state.

functional_requirements.description: The user interface must be responsive and provide a good user experience on various devices.
acceptance_criteria: The application layout adjusts cleanly for desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes.
All functionality is accessible and usable on smaller screens.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should load quickly and provide a smooth user experience without noticeable delays in interactions.
metrics: Initial page load time under 2 seconds.
UI response to user actions (add, edit, delete) under 200ms.

non_functional_requirements.description: The interface must be intuitive and easy to navigate for users without technical expertise.
metrics: A new user should be able to add, complete, and delete a task without instructions.

non_functional_requirements.description: The web application must function correctly across the latest versions of major web browsers.
metrics: Full functionality and consistent appearance on the latest two versions of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Apple Safari.

non_functional_requirements.description: User data must be reliably stored on the client-side.
metrics: Tasks persist after browser refresh and closing/reopening the tab.

backend: None (for the initial version using Local Storage)
Optional: Node.js with Express.js for a future version with user accounts.
database: Optional: MongoDB or PostgreSQL for a backend-enabled version.
devops: Static hosting platforms like GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel for deployment.

risks: Data Loss: Since data is stored in local storage, it can be lost if the user clears their browser cache or uses a different browser/device.
Scope Creep: Requests for features like user accounts, cloud synchronization, or collaborative lists would significantly increase complexity and timeline.
Cross-Browser Inconsistencies: Minor visual or functional bugs may arise due to differences in how browsers implement CSS and JavaScript.
assumptions: The initial version will use browser local storage for data persistence, not a backend database.
User authentication, user accounts, and data synchronization across multiple devices are out of scope for this project.
The application design will be simple and functional, without the need for complex animations or custom graphical assets.
The "prioritize or categorize" feature will be implemented in a simple manner, such as a text label, not a complex filtering and sorting system.
